text: Paul Aron (born 4 February 2004) is an Estonian racing driver currently racing in the Formula Renault Eurocup and a member of the Mercedes Junior Team. ==Career== ===Karting=== Starting in Estonia at the age 8, Aron climbed the karting ladder as he was soon racing all over Europe but mostly in Italy. Aron won the CIK-FIA European OK Junior Championship in 2018. ===Lower formula=== Aron raced in the 2019 ADAC Formula 4 Championship for Prema Powerteam, he finished 7th in the championship with 2 podiums both of which were wins at Austria and The Netherlands. Aron's more successful campaign in 2019 came in the Italian F4 Championship, also racing for Prema, he took 8 podiums and 2 wins. One of which being at the Red Bull Ring again, Aron finished the year in 3rd behind Red Bull junior driver Dennis Hauger and Brazilian Gianluca Petecof. ===Formula Renault Eurocup=== After testing with them in the post- season test at Paul Ricard in November 2019, Aron was signed to ART Grand Prix's new Formula Renault Eurocup outfit for the 2020 season. ===Formula One=== In July 2019, the Mercedes Formula One team added Aron to their junior team. ==Personal life== Aron's older brother is 2015 Italian F4 champion Ralf Aron. ==Racing record== ===Career summary=== {| class="wikitable" style="font- size: 90%; text-align:center" |- !
